bibl.title: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Mabel Colcord, January 20, 1942

div1.p: Howard informs Colcord that Hench may see her father's correspondence.

div1.head: Letter from Lucy T. Howard to Mabel Colcord, January 20, 1942

opener.dateline:
January 20, 1942 1705 TWENTY-FIRST STREET
WASHINGTON, D. C.

div1.p:
This is to introduce Dr Hench. He is
anxious to see any correspondence which Father may have had
with Walter Reed or Lazear or Carroll, which is on file
with you. Will you be good enough to give him any help
you can? He would like to make copies of whatever he finds
or to have them photographed.

Father is well and hopes to come down to see you
again in the spring.
div1.closer:
Yours cordially Lucy T. Howard
Miss Mabel Colcord
Library of Bureau of Entomology and Plant Quarantine
Department of Agriculture
